resources.name: crop_data

fields.name: harvest_year
fields.title: Year in which crop harvested
fields.description: Year in which the crop was harvested. It will generally have been sown the previous year

fields.name: plot
fields.title: Plot (also known as strip)
fields.description: Plot (also called strip) on Section 1 (continuous wheat). Each plot receives a different fertilizer or manure treatment

fields.name: fertilizer_code
fields.title: fertilizer and manure treatment code
fields.description: Code describing the fertilizer or manure applied in that harvest year to that plot

fields.name: fym_factor_level
fields.title: FYM factor level
fields.description: Code for the FYM factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: fym_date
fields.title: Date FYM applied
fields.description: Date FYM applied, usually in the autumn

fields.name: n_factor_level
fields.title: N factor level
fields.description: Code for the inorganic nitrogen fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: spring1_n_kg
fields.title: First spring fertilizer N amount
fields.description: Amount of N in first application of inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied in the spring to this crop. This may be the only application. This does not include N in FYM.

fields.name: spring1_n_date
fields.title: First spring fertilizer N date
fields.description: Date first application of inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied in the spring. This may be the only application.

fields.name: spring2_n_kg
fields.title: Second spring fertilizer N amount
fields.description: Amount of N in second application of inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied in the spring to this crop. This does not include N in FYM

fields.name: spring2_n_date
fields.title: Second spring fertilizer N date
fields.description: Date second application of inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied in the spring to this crop

fields.name: spring3_n_kg
fields.title: Third spring fertilizer N amount
fields.description: Amount of N in third application of inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied in the spring to this crop. This does not include N in FYM

fields.name: spring3_n_date
fields.title: Third spring fertilizer N date
fields.description: Date third application of inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied in the spring to this crop

fields.name: total_fertilizer_n_amount
fields.title: Total inorganic nitrogen fertilizer N amount
fields.description: Total inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied to this crop. This does not include N in FYM

fields.name: p_factor_level
fields.title: P factor level
fields.description: Code for the phosphorus fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: p_date
fields.title: P fertilizer application date
fields.description: Date phosphorus fertilizer applied in that harvest year

fields.name: k_factor_level
fields.title: K factor level
fields.description: Code for the potassium fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: k_date
fields.title: K fertilizer application date
fields.description: Date potassium fertilizer applied in that harvest year

fields.name: mg_factor_level
fields.title: Mg factor level
fields.description: Code for the magnesium fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: mg_date
fields.title: Mg fertilizer application date
fields.description: Date magnesium fertilizer applied in that harvest year

fields.name: sow_date
fields.title: Sowing date
fields.description: Date the crop was sown, generally in the autumn in the year before harvest

fields.name: harvest_date
fields.title: Harvest date
fields.description: Date the crop was harvested

fields.name: cultivar
fields.title: Wheat cultivar
fields.description: Wheat cultivar or variety

fields.name: area_ha
fields.title: Cropped area
fields.description: Harvested area of plot

fields.name: grain_yield
fields.title: Grain yield
fields.description: Harvested wheat grain yield at 85% dry matter

fields.name: straw_yield
fields.title: Straw yield
fields.description: Harvested wheat straw yield at 85% dry matter. This does not include stubble or part of the chaff.

fields.name: grain_%_n
fields.title: Grain % N
fields.description: % nitrogen in harvested wheat grain at 100% dry matter

fields.name: straw_%_n
fields.title: Straw % N
fields.description: % nitrogen in harvested wheat straw at 100% dry matter. This does not include stubble or part of the chaff.

fields.name: grain_kgN
fields.title: Grain N uptake
fields.description: Harvested grain nitrogen content at 100% dry matter

fields.name: straw_kgN
fields.title: Straw N uptake
fields.description: Harvested straw nitrogen content at 100% dry matter. This does not include stubble or part of the chaff.

fields.name: note
fields.title: Note
fields.description: Whether notes are applied or not

resources.title: crop yield and N uptake data
resources.description: The main data table containing annual harvested grain and straw yield and nitrogen content data for all plots of Section 1,  harvest years 2001-2015. Also included are details of all fertilizer and manure treatments, and other agronomic information, including sowing and harvest dates, amount, type and date of application of fertilizer and manure treatments, and winter wheat cultivars.  Section 1 has grown winter wheat continually since 1843, except for fallow years to control weeds, the last in 1966. Each plot (or strip) tests a different fertilizer or manure treatment. The Broadbalk Wheat experiment was started in 1843, most treatment strips were established in 1852 and remained unchanged until 1968. See Supplementary Materials (Rothamsted Research 2021b) for full details of the fertilizer treatments applied to each plot since 1852. Years refer to harvest years, ie the year that the crop was harvested. Grain and straw yields at 85% dry matter.

fields.name: amount
fields.title: Amount
fields.description: Total inorganic nitrogen (N) fertilizer which was applied to this crop as a treatment factor. This does not include N in FYM or rape cake. Note at different periods of the experiment N was variously applied in autumn or spring and applied in a single application or split applications. Timings and amounts of N applied are indicated in the crop_data table in the fields autumn_n_kg, autumn_n_date, spring1_n_kg, spring1_n_date, spring2_n_kg and spring2_n_date

name: broadbalk-wheat-experiment-yields-and-n-uptake-section-1,-2001-2015
title: Broadbalk Wheat Experiment yields and N uptake Section 1, 2001-2015
description:
### Abstract
This dataset contains the annual harvested grain and straw yields and N content for each treatment plot of the Broadbalk Wheat Experiment, Section 1 (continuous wheat) 2001-2015. Also other agronomic information including sowing and harvest date, amount, type and date of application of fertilizers and manure, and wheat varieties.
### Methods
The Broadbalk Wheat Experiment was started in 1843. Each plot (strip) tests the effects of different fertilizers and manures on the yield of winter wheat. Many treatments remained unchanged from 1852-1967. In 1968 the experiment was divided into 10 Sections, to compare continuous wheat with wheat grown in rotation with other arable crops, and new fertilizer treatments were introduced. Yields increased due to the introduction of modern cultivars, pest and disease control. Data is presented here for Section 1, which has grown wheat every year, except for fallow years to control weeds, the last in 1966. Details are given of the fertilizer treatments applied 2001-2015. For full details of the fertilizer treatments applied 1852-2000 refer to Related Documents.
### Technical Info
Wheat grain and straw yields have been recorded every year since the experiment began. Straw yields are that removed by the combine harvester, they do not include the stubble or part of the chaff. Yields are expressed at 85% dry matter. Grain and straw % N content were measured by combustion analysis (LECO). Winter wheat was grown every year, except for 2015, when the spring wheat variety Mulika was sown, as it was too wet to sow the usual winter wheat in the autumn.
### Provenance
Annual yields are taken from the individual plot yields of grain and straw in the BKYIELD_R85 dataset in the e-RA database. Grain and straw N content are taken from the BKWHNUTRI dataset in the e-RA database. The Rothamsted 'Yield Books', held in the Rothamsted Library Archive, were used to check the treatments applied to the plots.
### Quality
In accordance with the Joint Code of Practice for Research at Rothamsted, data processing in e-RA follow rigorous standard operating procedures to ensure the quality and correctness of data collected in the field through to depositing in the e-RA database.  Once the data were entered into e-RA, they were independently back-checked against the original data sheets.
